title: Joan Sutherland in concert
creator_contributor_role: Western Australian Opera Company, production company
abstract: Tornami a vagheggiar from Handel's "Alcina"--Addio del Passato from Verdi's "La Traviata"--A Mezzanotte by Donizetti--Chanson de Zora from Rossini's "La Petite bohemienne"--O beau pays de la Touraine from Meyerbeer's "Les Hugenots"--Aimant la rose, le rossignol by Rimsky-Korsakov--Bonnie Marie of Argyle Anon--Songs my mother taught me by Dvorak--Serenata by Tosti--Bel raggio lusinghier from Rossini's "Semiramide"--There's no place like home
description: Dame Joan Sutherland, "La Stupenda", accompanied by her husband/arranger and renowned pianist, Richard Bonynge, gives an outstanding performance with a program that is rich and varied from the dramatic to the light-hearted. This full-length recital was recorded at the Perth Concert Hall on 9 March 1982 for television.
